descriptions: The student is unable to identify basic shapes (squares, circles, triangles, rectangles, hexagons, cubes, cones, cylinders, and spheres).
The student can identify a few basic shapes with significant errors.
The student can identify most basic shapes but makes occasional errors.
The student accurately identifies all basic shapes.
The student accurately identifies all basic shapes and can provide examples from the real world.
The student accurately identifies all basic shapes, provides real-world examples, and explains the properties of each shape.
The student does not use positional words (above, below, beside, in front of, behind, next to) or uses them incorrectly.
The student uses a limited number of positional words with frequent errors.
The student uses some positional words but still makes errors in their application.
The student accurately uses positional words to describe the location of objects.
The student accurately and consistently uses a variety of positional words to describe the relative positions of objects.
The student accurately and creatively uses a wide range of positional words to describe complex spatial relationships between objects.
The student cannot relate shapes and positions to real-world objects.
The student struggles to connect shapes and positions to real-world objects.
The student can identify some real-world objects that match the shapes and positions described, but with limited success.
The student effectively describes real-world objects using shape names and positional words.
The student consistently and accurately describes a wide range of real-world objects using appropriate shape names and positional words.
The student demonstrates a sophisticated understanding of shapes and positions by accurately and creatively describing complex real-world scenarios and objects.
